title: Docxes
description: A Documentation Engine Build with Typecript to enhance performance and reduced resources usage.
content: ### Introduction Documentation Engine that is independent on frameworks build with Typescript focused on Scalability and Performance that reduce both Server and Client usage make documentation more efficient on build time. It build Pre-compiled documentation on build time that helps the web to fetch and load quickly from pre-compiled data generated by docxes engine.

title: Features
description: Docxes Engine provides 10+ features that make itself independent on any React frameworks.
content: ### Docxes latest features The Docxes Engine is a high-performance documentation processor with the following core features: 1. Multi-Version Documentation Support - Version Discovery: Automatically detects versions based on the directory structure in the content folder. - Version-Specific Navigation: Generates independent navigation trees for each version. - Production Manifest: In production, it can load a pre-built manifest.json for near-instant routing and content retrieval. 2. Advanced MDX Processing - Compiler Pipeline: Uses `next-mdx-remote` to transform MDX into serializable output. - Frontmatter Extraction: Built-in support for `gray-matter` to handle page metadata `(title, description, order, etc.)`. - Syntax Highlighting: Integrated `rehype-pretty-code` for beautiful code blocks with theme customization (defaulting to `github-dark`). - Automatic ID Generation: Uses `rehype-slug` to ensure all headings are linkable. 3. Smart Caching System - Granular Invalidation: Uses `SHA-256` hashing to track changes in source content, MDX configuration, plugin lists, and slugify logic. - Persistence: A `CacheManager` stores processed results in a `.docxes` directory to avoid redundant compilations. 4. Extensible Plugin Architecture - Lifecycle Hooks: Provides four strategic hooks for third-party extensions: - beforeParse: Modify raw strings before parsing. - afterParse: Manipulate the `Markdown AST` or `frontmatter`. - beforeCompile: Transform content right before MDX compilation. - afterRender: Post-process the compiled output. 5. Automated Content Intelligence - TOC Generation: A dedicated AST visitor `(ast/toc.ts)` extracts headings to build hierarchical Table of Contents. - Search Indexing: Generates a comprehensive search index including `titles, descriptions, keywords, and searchable plain-text content`. - Automatic Navigation: Infers hierarchy from file paths and respects an order property in frontmatter for manual sorting. 6. Developer Tooling (CLI) - Build Command: A binary utility to pre-compile the entire documentation site and export a static search index to public/ folder named `search-index.json` with use of tsx command. - Clean Command: Quickly clears the engine's cache by tsx. - Flexible Config: Supports a custom slugify function and configurable document paths via `x-meta.config.tsx`. 7. Content Management - Hidden Files: Automatically ignores files prefixed with . or containing `.hidden` (e.g., comparison.hidden.mdx). - Flexible Entry Points: Supports both filename.mdx and `folder/main.mdx` patterns. ![Programiz](https://cdn.playground-v2.programiz.com/assets/logos/logo.svg)
